page.title: 10SUTTON AND SUTTON VILLAGE
page.content: With the{River Deben}on its West flank, this area looks across this tidal river to the small town of {Woodbridge. In its gently undulating landscape, large fields of intensively cultivated farmland lie sheltered by woodland. At the northern boundary two long straight roads divide the area. One leads eastwards to the{Woodbridge {Base.}Here American personnel are involved in the defence of Europe. The other road runs southwards passing a wooded picnic spot before entering the little village of{Sutton. Close to the{Deben}is the important archaeological site of{Sutton Hoo. Along the marshy shoreline of the Deben Estuary is much varied birdlife Boats sail to and fro in a safe haven, ten miles from the open sea.
